title: Woman sues American Airlines for sexual assault on flight: 'They didn't prevent'
content: A New Jersey woman has sued American Airlines for not doing enough to stop her from getting sexually assaulted by a stranger male passenger who was sitting next to her in a two-hour flight in 2022. The Independent reported that the flight was going from North Carolina to Newark Liberty International Airport where the woman was seated between her friend and an unknown male passenger.
summary: A New Jersey woman has sued American Airlines for not doing enough to stop her from getting sexually assaulted by a stranger male passenger who was sitting next to her in a two-hour flight in 2022. The Independent reported that the flight was going from North Carolina to Newark Liberty International Airport where the woman was seated between her friend and an unknown male passenger.

title: Israeli military rescues hostage abducted in Hamas' October 7 attack
content: The Israeli military has rescued a 52-year-old Arab citizen, Qaid Farhan Alkadi, in a complex operation following his abduction by Hamas during their October 7 attack. This attack killed over 1,200 people and kidnapped nearly 250. Israel's retaliation has resulted in over 40,000 Palestinian deaths and widespread destruction in Gaza, displacing 90% of its population.
summary: The Israeli military has rescued a 52-year-old Arab citizen, Qaid Farhan Alkadi, in a complex operation following his abduction by Hamas during their October 7 attack. This attack killed over 1,200 people and kidnapped nearly 250. Israel's retaliation has resulted in over 40,000 Palestinian deaths and widespread destruction in Gaza, displacing 90% of its population.

title: Fox host Jesse Watters jokes about generals 'having their way' with Kamala Harris: 'Not sexual'
content: Fox host Jesse Watters made unsavory comments about vice president Kamala Harris on air in a panel and when he was asked to take back his words, he said he did not mean what he said in a sexual way. “What is her foreign policy? This is where the president has his most impact. You have a lot of room to maneuver there as commander-in-chief. We don’t know who she is. We don’t know what she believes. She’s going to get paralyzed in the Situation Room while the generals have their way with her," Jesse said.
summary: Fox host Jesse Watters made unsavory comments about vice president Kamala Harris on air in a panel and when he was asked to take back his words, he said he did not mean what he said in a sexual way. “What is her foreign policy? This is where the president has his most impact. You have a lot of room to maneuver there as commander-in-chief. We don’t know who she is. We don’t know what she believes. She’s going to get paralyzed in the Situation Room while the generals have their way with her," Jesse said.

title: Elon Musk should be the hero but he became a villain because...: Kennedy Jr after Pavel Durov's arrest
content: "Somehow Elon Musk became the villain because he was actually the only platform that would allow free speech. He's now become a villain because the Democratic Party does not believe in the people," Kennedy said in an interview with Tucker Carlson as he commented on Telegram CEO's arrest. Pavel was arrested in France on allegations of drug trafficking and sexual abuse of children.
summary: "Somehow Elon Musk became the villain because he was actually the only platform that would allow free speech. He's now become a villain because the Democratic Party does not believe in the people," Kennedy said in an interview with Tucker Carlson as he commented on Telegram CEO's arrest. Pavel was arrested in France on allegations of drug trafficking and sexual abuse of children.

title: US presidential elections: Tulsi Gabbard endorses Donald Trump as moderate Republicans flee MAGA
content: Tulsi Gabbard, a former Congresswoman, endorsed Donald Trump for the US presidency, critiquing her former party for alleged misuse of America's institutions. Known for opposing Democratic policies, Gabbard's endorsement follows independent candidate Robert Kennedy Jr.'s support for Trump. The Trump campaign accused Kamala Harris of trying to alter debate rules, intensifying the ongoing political clash.
summary: Tulsi Gabbard, a former Congresswoman, endorsed Donald Trump for the US presidency, critiquing her former party for alleged misuse of America's institutions. Known for opposing Democratic policies, Gabbard's endorsement follows independent candidate Robert Kennedy Jr.'s support for Trump. The Trump campaign accused Kamala Harris of trying to alter debate rules, intensifying the ongoing political clash.

title: 'Take it in my stride': World's oldest man celebrates 112th birthday
content: John Alfred Tinniswood, the world's oldest man at 112, celebrated his milestone birthday in Merseyside. Born in 1912, he attributes his longevity to luck and a modest lifestyle, including a weekly tradition of fish and chips. He reflected on his life, offering insights on moderation and resilience while providing advice to younger generations to always give their best effort.
summary: John Alfred Tinniswood, the world's oldest man at 112, celebrated his milestone birthday in Merseyside. Born in 1912, he attributes his longevity to luck and a modest lifestyle, including a weekly tradition of fish and chips. He reflected on his life, offering insights on moderation and resilience while providing advice to younger generations to always give their best effort.

title: Deepfake outrage in South Korea: President Yoon calls for immediate action as Telegram faces backlash
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol called for an investigation into digital sex crimes after reports of deepfake images of South Korean women being shared on Telegram. The arrests of suspects, including Telegram's founder over related crimes, has heightened concerns. The Korea Communications Standards Commission plans to address the escalating issue in an upcoming meeting.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol called for an investigation into digital sex crimes after reports of deepfake images of South Korean women being shared on Telegram. The arrests of suspects, including Telegram's founder over related crimes, has heightened concerns. The Korea Communications Standards Commission plans to address the escalating issue in an upcoming meeting.

title: Watch: Woman jumps dangerously close to tiger in zoo, misses getting attacked narrowly
content: New Jersey police arrested Zyair Dennis, 24, for defiant trespassing and violating city ordinances after she climbed a fence at Cohanzick Zoo to approach a Siberian tiger, risking an attack. Footage showed Dennis narrowly avoiding being bitten. Authorities released the video to locate Dennis, leading to her arrest. She awaits a court date.
summary: New Jersey police arrested Zyair Dennis, 24, for defiant trespassing and violating city ordinances after she climbed a fence at Cohanzick Zoo to approach a Siberian tiger, risking an attack. Footage showed Dennis narrowly avoiding being bitten. Authorities released the video to locate Dennis, leading to her arrest. She awaits a court date.

title: Violence mars Notting Hill carnival: Multiple stabbings, hundreds arrested at Europe's largest street festival
content: Eight people were stabbed during the two-day Notting Hill Carnival, Europe's largest street festival, with a 32-year-old woman in critical condition. Over 230 arrests were made, and 35 police officers were injured. The carnival celebrates Afro-Caribbean culture and attracted over 1 million attendees, emphasizing unity in response to recent racial tensions.
summary: Eight people were stabbed during the two-day Notting Hill Carnival, Europe's largest street festival, with a 32-year-old woman in critical condition. Over 230 arrests were made, and 35 police officers were injured. The carnival celebrates Afro-Caribbean culture and attracted over 1 million attendees, emphasizing unity in response to recent racial tensions.

title: Human Y chromosome on the verge of extinction – but there's hope: Study
content: A study revealed that the Y chromosome, which determines male sex, is degenerating and may vanish in a few million years. Research on Sry-deficient Amami spiny rats, which lost the Y chromosome but still reproduce, suggests humans might evolve a new male-determining gene, offering hope for survival despite the Y chromosome's decline.
summary: A study revealed that the Y chromosome, which determines male sex, is degenerating and may vanish in a few million years. Research on Sry-deficient Amami spiny rats, which lost the Y chromosome but still reproduce, suggests humans might evolve a new male-determining gene, offering hope for survival despite the Y chromosome's decline.

title: ‘No lifeboat to safety’: UN chief Guterres urges global action as Pacific faces sea-level crisis
Former Malaysian PM Muhyiddin Yassin charged with sedition over remarks on Monarch
content: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin was charged with sedition for questioning the integrity of the last king in a speech. Muhyiddin pleaded not guilty, asserting that his comments were based on facts. Critics argue the Sedition Act is misused to suppress dissent. Muhyiddin also faces separate corruption charges, which he claims are politically motivated.
summary: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin was charged with sedition for questioning the integrity of the last king in a speech. Muhyiddin pleaded not guilty, asserting that his comments were based on facts. Critics argue the Sedition Act is misused to suppress dissent. Muhyiddin also faces separate corruption charges, which he claims are politically motivated.

title: Helium leak delays launch of SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn Mission
content: SpaceX postponed the launch of its 'Polaris Dawn' mission due to a helium leak. The mission, aimed to send four private citizens, including billionaire Jared Isaacman and SpaceX engineers, on a multi-day journey in low-Earth orbit, was delayed to address the issue. This mission also planned the first civilian spacewalk and intended to study space radiation effects.
summary: SpaceX postponed the launch of its 'Polaris Dawn' mission due to a helium leak. The mission, aimed to send four private citizens, including billionaire Jared Isaacman and SpaceX engineers, on a multi-day journey in low-Earth orbit, was delayed to address the issue. This mission also planned the first civilian spacewalk and intended to study space radiation effects.

title: British Colombia to lift fire ban for coast and southeast soon
content: Officials announced the lifting of campfire bans in British Columbia’s coast and southeast regions due to prolonged wet and cool weather. Category 1 fires will be allowed, while larger fires and items like fireworks remain banned. The ban was lifted for the Coastal and Southeast Fire Centres, following similar actions in Cariboo and Prince George's regions.
summary: Officials announced the lifting of campfire bans in British Columbia’s coast and southeast regions due to prolonged wet and cool weather. Category 1 fires will be allowed, while larger fires and items like fireworks remain banned. The ban was lifted for the Coastal and Southeast Fire Centres, following similar actions in Cariboo and Prince George's regions.

title: Earthquake of 5.9 magnitude strikes Darwin
content: A 5.9 magnitude earthquake struck the Banda Sea, near Darwin, Australia, on Tuesday, reported at a depth of 62 km. The Bureau of Meteorology confirmed there was no tsunami threat.
summary: A 5.9 magnitude earthquake struck the Banda Sea, near Darwin, Australia, on Tuesday, reported at a depth of 62 km. The Bureau of Meteorology confirmed there was no tsunami threat.

title: 'Barcelona or die.' For Senegalese dreaming of Europe, the deadly Atlantic route is not a deterrent
content: Salamba Ndiaye, a young Senegalese woman, has repeatedly tried to reach Spain to escape poverty and lack of job opportunities. Despite past failures and dangers of the Atlantic route, she remains determined. The depletion of fish stocks due to international agreements has worsened local living conditions, pushing many to risk their lives for better prospects in Europe.
summary: Salamba Ndiaye, a young Senegalese woman, has repeatedly tried to reach Spain to escape poverty and lack of job opportunities. Despite past failures and dangers of the Atlantic route, she remains determined. The depletion of fish stocks due to international agreements has worsened local living conditions, pushing many to risk their lives for better prospects in Europe.

title: Canada to slap 100% tariff on Chinese electric vehicles
content: Canada announced a 100 per cent tariff on Chinese electric vehicles and a 25 per cent tariff on steel and aluminum imports from China. This move aligns with similar actions by the US and EU in response to China's market practices, aiming to protect Canada's interests in the global electric vehicle supply chain.
summary: Canada announced a 100 per cent tariff on Chinese electric vehicles and a 25 per cent tariff on steel and aluminum imports from China. This move aligns with similar actions by the US and EU in response to China's market practices, aiming to protect Canada's interests in the global electric vehicle supply chain.

title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg says he was ‘pressured’ by Joe Biden to pull Covid content
content: Mark Zuckerberg claimed that Facebook was pressured by the US government to censor COVID-19 content during the pandemic and expressed regret over their compliance. Facebook removed over 20 million posts, sparking criticism. Zuckerberg's letter to the US House Judiciary Committee highlighted the debate on the extent of content moderation on social media platforms.
summary: Mark Zuckerberg claimed that Facebook was pressured by the US government to censor COVID-19 content during the pandemic and expressed regret over their compliance. Facebook removed over 20 million posts, sparking criticism. Zuckerberg's letter to the US House Judiciary Committee highlighted the debate on the extent of content moderation on social media platforms.

title: Australia announces cap on international student enrolment for 2025
content: Australia announced a cap of 270,000 on international student enrolment for 2025 to manage record migration levels. This decision, part of broader reforms, aims to address rising home rental prices. The education sector remains a significant export industry, but high immigration has strained the housing market, becoming a key issue ahead of the next election.
summary: Australia announced a cap of 270,000 on international student enrolment for 2025 to manage record migration levels. This decision, part of broader reforms, aims to address rising home rental prices. The education sector remains a significant export industry, but high immigration has strained the housing market, becoming a key issue ahead of the next election.

title: Mpox: Germany to give Africa 100,000 doses of vaccine
content: Germany announced it would donate 100,000 mpox vaccine doses to the Democratic Republic of Congo and other African nations to control an outbreak. This donation nearly depletes Germany's military reserve and includes financial support. Other countries, like France and the US, have also pledged doses to combat the disease spreading in multiple African countries and beyond.
summary: Germany announced it would donate 100,000 mpox vaccine doses to the Democratic Republic of Congo and other African nations to control an outbreak. This donation nearly depletes Germany's military reserve and includes financial support. Other countries, like France and the US, have also pledged doses to combat the disease spreading in multiple African countries and beyond.
